titles.title: To amend the Service Contract Act of 1965 to require entities that enter into certain services contracts with the Federal Government or the District of Columbia to offer the employees that carry out the services before the award of a contract the right to continue employment after the award of the contract.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Workforce Protections.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

bill.summary: 4/10/2000--Introduced. Amends the Service Contract Act of 1965 to require entities that enter into services contracts with the United States or the District of Columbia, where the total of the amount of the revenue generated by such services during the year prior to the award of the contract and the amount of the value of the contract is in excess of $100,000, to offer to the employees that carry out such services before the award of the contract a right of first refusal to continue employment for such purpose after the award of the contract.
